page.title: 16Shopping Facilities
page.content: As this area of the Roseland Peninsula is fairly isolated,very few large businesses have developed.There is a fairly steady trade in the shops from local customers,but in the summer the trade increases a great deal. {Shopping Facilities.} The majority of the shops in the area stock only the basic needs of the customer.Shopping,such as the buying of furniture,clothing and other large items,must be done in St.Austell,Truro and Falmouth. There are clothing shops in St.Mawes itself but,these are very expensive and tend to sell fairly traditional styles.Also they do not stock a great variety of items.The sale of clothing is fairly slow as shops do not have large numbers of customers to keep large stocks or different styles,nor can they follow fashions as stock{PTO
